skill.name: dnanexus-integration
skill.description: DNAnexus cloud genomics platform. Build apps/applets, manage data (upload/download), dxpy Python SDK, run workflows, FASTQ/BAM/VCF, for genomics pipeline development and execution.
skill.summary: DNAnexus cloud genomics platform. Build apps/applets, manage data (upload/download), dxpy Python SDK...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing reference material for DNAnexus platform. No executable code. Documents legitimate genomics operations with standard security practices. Risk from filesystem access patterns in example code is appropriate for data processing use case.

content.value_statement: DNAnexus is a cloud platform for biomedical data analysis. This skill provides complete reference documentation for building apps, managing data, running workflows, and using the dxpy Python SDK for genomics pipeline development.
actual_capabilities: Build and deploy DNAnexus apps and applets using dxpy SDK
Upload, download, search, and organize files and records on the platform
Run analyses, monitor jobs, and create multi-step workflows
Configure app dependencies including system packages, Python libraries, and Docker
Process bioinformatics file formats (FASTQ, BAM, VCF)
Manage projects, permissions, and platform resources
limitations: Requires active DNAnexus account and API authentication
Execution costs depend on compute instance types and runtime
Does not provide pre-built bioinformatics tools; must be installed separately
Network access may be restricted by organization policies

use_cases.title: Genomics pipeline development
use_cases.description: Build and deploy custom analysis pipelines for sequencing data processing and variant calling

use_cases.title: Cloud-based analysis
use_cases.description: Run large-scale genomic analyses without managing local compute infrastructure

use_cases.title: Automated workflows
use_cases.description: Create reproducible, scalable workflows for routine bioinformatics tasks

prompt_templates.title: Quick upload
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me upload sample.fastq to my DNAnexus project and run variant calling analysis using the dnanexus-integration skill

prompt_templates.title: Pipeline build
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a DNAnexus app structure for processing BAM files with quality metrics using the dnanexus-integration skill

prompt_templates.title: Workflow setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a multi-step workflow on DNAnexus that chains quality control, alignment, and variant calling using the dnanexus-integration skill

prompt_templates.title: SDK automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Python script using dxpy to search for all FASTQ files in a project, download them, and run parallel processing using the dnanexus-integration skill

output_examples.input: Upload my sequencing data to DNAnexus and run a basic quality control analysis
output: Upload complete: sample.fastq uploaded to project-xxxx:/raw_data/
Quality control analysis started with default parameters
Results will be available in /results/ folder upon completion

best_practices: Use environment variables or dx login for authentication rather than hardcoding API tokens
Select appropriate instance types based on workload requirements to balance cost and performance
Close files and records after writing to make them immutable and accessible to other users
Tag jobs and data objects with experiment metadata for easier discovery and organization
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API tokens or credentials in source code or configuration files
Running large analyses on minimal instance types causing out-of-memory failures
Leaving temporary files or failed jobs accumulating in project storage
Skipping error handling for API calls that may fail due to network or permissions issues

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported for DNAnexus apps?
faq.answer: Python and Bash are fully supported. Apps use the dxpy SDK for Python or shell scripts with dx command-line tools.

faq.question: What instance types are available and how do I choose?
faq.answer: Instance types range from 2 to 36 cores with varying memory. Use smaller types for testing and larger types for compute-intensive bioinformatics tasks.

faq.question: How do I authenticate with the DNAnexus API?
faq.answer: Run 'dx login' in terminal or set DX_SECURITY_CONTEXT environment variable with your API token. Never hardcode tokens in code.

faq.question: Is my data secure on the DNAnexus platform?
faq.answer: DNAnexus encrypts data at rest and in transit. Access is controlled by project permissions. You manage who can view or edit your data.

faq.question: Why did my job fail with out-of-memory error?
faq.answer: Increase instance type in dxapp.json systemRequirements. Larger instance types provide more RAM for memory-intensive bioinformatics tools.

faq.question: How does DNAnexus compare to other genomics clouds?
faq.answer: DNAnexus specializes in bioinformatics with pre-built tools, compliance features, and optimized infrastructure. AWS/GCP offer more general compute but require more setup.
